intro: Rhynchospora eximia var. multiflorens, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. It thrives in moist to wet soils, often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in maintaining wetland biodiversity and water filtration.
